intro: Stachyarrhena oellgardii, commonly known as the narrow-leafed mistflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, pale blue to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. Stachyarrhena oellgardii is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
